text: <@U22PJPGK0> are you able to enable customer portals for HubDB? Or is this something that I would have to go to a channel account manager for?
Here is the HubID I need setup: 1955602
<@U22PU4G4A> and <@U22PJPGK0> We also need one set up for a portal ID, who do we ask for this or can we enable it on our end?
<@U22PJPGK0> I’m also working on another client’s portal and for some reason I’m not able to create a new table when I click on the button in the top right hand corner
here is the portal ID 1997232
this is the right place to ask! Doing that now
<@U2LEJ045D> here you go <https://app.HubSpot.com/hubdb/1955602>
<@U26CZR9MW> what’s the portal ID you’d like enabled for HubDB?
<@U23602KDF> thanks Jennifer!
Appreciate it
hmm <@U2LEJ045D> I was also able to reproduce that issue in <https://app.HubSpot.com/hubdb/1997232>
I’ll check with the team and let you know
great thanks <@U23602KDF>
<@U2LEJ045D> 1997232 doesn’t have the websites Add-On, which they will need in order to use HubDB
oh ok
that makes sense - I’ll let them know that they need to enable that
thanks <@U23602KDF>
can we have HubDB enabled for portal 1920659 please?
<@U26CZR9MW> sure thing — done
Thank you!!
<@U22PJPGK0> <@U23602KDF> if the csv file has a header row why is it asking us to map the columns? shouldn’t that be done automatically to the header items?

We are trying to create a table from (import of) a csv containing all the necessary fields but it only allows us to map to “Name”. Are we expected to manually create the column header fields in HubDB first, and then import with the same header data? Seems counterintuitive yes?
I'm not sure the answer to any of that
but this is beta
We even exported the blank table that came up in our portal when it was enabled just a little bit ago, so we have all of the necessary hs_ fields
Okay thank you <@U25PYL3Q8> for the heads up
yeah, you do need to create the tables ahead of time because we need to know what types they are. In the future perhaps we have "new column" be one of the options

<@U25PYL3Q8> <@U22PJPGK0> after publishing a table and then plugging this documentation example into one of our templates with the correct values we get nothing returned…. {% for row in hubdb_table_rows(<tableId>, <filterQuery>) %}
  {{ row.hs_id }}={{ row.<column name> }}
{% endfor %} ….do we need to initiate the database some other way?
did you publish the table?
<@U2MCE88GL> I’ve ungated HubDB for your customers
yes we published the table
can you link to your page?
There is nothing in the documentation that indicates how to pull this data other than plain text via the API call, but when placed in a page, nothing happens
I'd be happy to take a look at your COS page to see what's going on
